docs.lead_paragraph: Akira Suwa/Philadelphia Inquirer, via Associated PressCaring for a baby at St. Christopher's Hospital, part of Tenet Healthcare Systems.10:25 p.m. | Updated Community Health Systems on Thursday announced a $3.3 billion unsolicited offer for a smaller rival, Tenet Healthcare, hoping to seize upon the Obama administration's overhaul of health care to create a new hospital giant.

headline.main: Hospital Bid May Create New Giant

docs.abstract: Community Health Systems announces $3.3 billion unsolicited offer for Tenet Healthcare, hoping to take advantage of health care overhaul legislation and create new hospital giant; offer shows how changes in regulation are likely to shape strategic health care industry decisions; Community Health Systems, much like other health industry leaders, hopes to be ready for 2014, when new law will reduce number of uninsured Americans and increase number of paying patients (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: Governor-elect Andrew M. Cuomo announced on Thursday the first senior appointments in his incoming administration, drawing largely on a mix of trusted old hands from the attorney general's office and alumni of his father's administration, along with a few new faces, to assemble his administration.

docs.lead_paragraph: The federal government is planning to sell a significant part of its shares in the American International Group - perhaps as much as one-fifth - in the first quarter of 2011 as it begins to unwind its ownership stake, people briefed on the matter said on Wednesday.
